location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Colonel Robert Phayre, The Political Superintendent, Frontier Upper Sind, Jacobabad to Captain Charles Henry Harrison, Political Agent, Khelat [Kalāt]

mods.abstract: Letter regarding entries in Captain Harrison's political diary regarding correspondence which the Khan of Khelat [Kalāt] had commenced with Ibrahim Khan of Chagkansoor [Chakhānsūr], Seistan [Sīstān] and regarding a statement within the correspondence that his people were originally subjects of Khelat and requesting the Khan's aid against the Persians.The Colonel's letter states that the areas of Seistan and Chagkansoor are claimed by the Afghan's and that the Ameer of Caubool [Amir of Kabul], Shere Ally Khan [Shir 'Ali Khan] was in communication with the Government of India regarding the province and its fort and requesting that owing to this Captain Harrison ask the Khan to discontinue his correspondence with Ibrahim Khan.
